news.title: Government shutdown: 'Democrats should do the right thing,' Speaker Johnson says
news.summary: Democrats insist that any stopgap funding bill included an extension of enhance Affordable Care Act tax credits. Those tax credits are due to expire at the end of 2025.

news.title: Here's JPMorgan Chase's blueprint to become the world’s first fully AI-powered megabank
news.summary: JPMorgan is being "fundamentally rewired" to automate knowledge work across its operations, its data chief says. JPMorgan is the world's largest bank by market cap.

news.title: It's Amazon's turn to show off new devices: All eyes on Alexa+, Echo and Kindle
news.summary: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in February teased artificial intelligence upgrades to its devices lineup. The company is expected to unveil a new version of its Kindle Fire tablet later this year.

news.title: CoreWeave stock climbs 10% after company lands $14 billion deal with Meta
news.summary: CoreWeave has inked a $14.2 billion AI cloud infrastructure deal with Meta. CoreWeave and Meta will work together to develop AI-powered cloud services.

news.title: Boston Fed President Collins sees caution on future interest rate cuts
news.summary: Collins expressed support for the recent interest rate cut but skepticism on future moves. Collins: "I don't think we're going to see a rate hike in the United States for a long time"

news.title: Can CoreWeave’s stock rise another 40%? A new bull makes the case.
news.summary: CoreWeave has a lot of debt and a concentrated customer base. Evercore ISI thinks the stock can keep gaining thanks to technological advantages and an improving interest rate environment.

news.title: My wife and I are in our 40s. We have a $600K mortgage and $500K income. Can we afford a vacation home?
news.summary: “We plan to work another 20 years and we estimate $3-$4 million in 401(k) savings,” he says.

news.title: Sudden acceleration, not a bubble, is the AI story that investors are missing, says this top researcher
news.summary: A prominent AI researcher says those worried about an AI bubble, should be thinking about widespread integration by next year instead. A blog post by a prominentAI researcher said those worried About an AI Bubble should be Thinking About Widespread Integration by Next year.

news.title: Fermi’s IPO to showcase Wall Street fervor for AI — and the Trump effect
news.summary: Fermi has yet to generate revenue as it readies its IPO of 32.5 million shares at an estimated price range of $18 to $22 each.

news.title: ‘I won’t let the government walk all over me’: The IRS says I owe $14,000 for not declaring my Social Security. What now?
news.summary: “I will take the IRS to court, if I must,” he said. “I’m not afraid to go to court.”
